result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge be paid due no later than 7-6-2023. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs due to indigency.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence, with credit for 105 DAYS served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Lamar Frazier

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 105 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 7-6-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs due to indigency.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered charge amended to MISDEMEANOR RETAIL THEFT - INTENTIONALLY TAKE (<= $500), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer M. Musa.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meijer - Oak Creek

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Frazier in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Lamar Frazier appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
